contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} [[Image:Turku, Yli-Maaria.png|thumb|right|Yli-Maaria on a map of Turku.]] '''Yli-Maaria''' ([[Finnish language|Finnish]]; ''Ã–vre S:t Marie'' in [[Finland-Swedish|Swedish]]) is a [[district]] in the [[Maaria-Paattinen]] ward of the city of [[Turku]], in [[Finland]]. It is located to the north of the city, and is a very sparsely populated area. The district was previously part of the municipality of [[Maaria]], which was annexed into Turku in 1967. The current ({{As of|2004|lc=on}}) population of Yli-Maaria is 2,209, and it is increasing at an annual rate of 3.71%. 32.10% of the district's population are under 15 years old, while 4.89% are over 65. The district's [[language|linguistic]] makeup is 97.24% Finnish, 1.49% Swedish, and 1.27% other. ==See also== * [[Districts of Turku]] * [[Districts of Turku by population]] {{Turku 9 districts}} {{Coord|60|33|06|N|22|18|35|E|display=title}} [[Category:Districts of Turku]] {{WesternFinland-geo-stub}}
